summary: It is beautifully done, filled with interesting facts and easy to ...

reviewText: Each page is full of great info. Great addition for space enthusiast.

One of the coolest purchases I've ever made. I'll absolutely be getting next year's calendar as well. All the extra cool facts and information about everything space-related make every day interesting. There are even "this day in space history" tidbits on most squares, moon phase indicators on every day, monthly sky guides for viewing various planets and other interesting celestial bodies, and even coordinates for telescopes. You'll learn something new every day for sure if you have this calendar! 10/10, would absolutely reccomend
summary: All the extra cool facts and information about everything space-related make every day ...

reviewText: Great pictures and useful information.

This thing is Big!  It's a bunch of beautiful space photos.  We belong in Space.  Going there is more money than I care to spend, more than I could ever afford, and likely more than I can crowdfund.  This shows your support for space activities.  As always, exploration pays back way more than it costs, and this calendar helps support people who believe in the future as limitless, not a place to hide but a place to rush toward.

Maybe the Affordable Space Travel Act will make it free.  Then we can all go there several times a year, right?  I can't wait. But I have to, so for the moment I have a gorgeous calendar on my wall.

Buy it.  You won't be disappointed.
summary: Not all Who Wander are Lost (Jrr Tolkien).  If you think we belong in space, this is for you.

reviewText: While the item is a larger format as claimed, the actual calendar itself is not. The bottom half is not all calendar.  If you're a space buff, you will probably like this; however, if you were looking for a balanced calendar that also highlights holidays and provides ample space for writing, this is not it.  The date areas have the moon phases and  lots of anniversaries including birthdays of people you probably never heard of.
summary: Educational, Nice to Look at, but has Limitations

reviewText: I got this for someone else. It will be hung in his garage
Its a big calendar! Awesome illustrations and facts. I like it a lot.
Quick delivery, great item, Thanks!

summary: By far the coolest calendar to have on your wall.

reviewText:
Gorgeous!  That's it!  And it's huge!

Also time for a plug.  If you love space exploration you should join The Planetary Society.  I've been a member almost since Carl Sagan and Luis Freemen started it.

Great calender!! So much information to absorb! Very detailed and so many fun facts related to space exploration.

reviewText: EXCELLENT! This is the second year I have ordered The Year in Space calendar, and I will continue to order it in the future.

reviewText: I have enjoyed the desktop calendars for years. the wall calendars are just as good if not better.

We not only purchase the large Wall Calendar, but the desk version as well, each year.  The pictures and information are exceptional.  We have been ordering these for several years now and have enjoyed them so much that we give them as gifts as well.
It's a very pretty and very informative calendar. I use it at the office, and it has sparked a few good discussions about astronomy and physics, and even history.

I love this calendar. Anyone who is interested in our efforts in the space program, and all aspects of astronomy can benefit from the daily information that appears for every significant date. The artwork and historical data are the result of much research by it's author who also publishes a weekly update on astronomical events on the internet.  I highly recommend it.  Ralph Kuenz

Best calender ever. Seriously. The large size, awesome pictures, the wealth of information (facts, moon phases, bios,This-Day-In-History, sky guide, US holidays) ... It's hard to see how any other calendar can top it. One of the best price/quality ratio's in my experience.

As for Cons - I haven't found any that personally affect me. Although, I suppose, if you are a person who wants to use it as a daily planner, it will be hard to add a lot of detail since, as already noted, the US holidays, moon phase, and this-day-in-history facts already crowd the day box. You might want to go for a different calendar in this case.
The calendar is large, but it's filled with data. We will enjoy reading the information for each month as 2015 passes.
summary: Lots of interesting stuff in this calendar

reviewText: Stunning and informative. The calendar is rich with facts and observables. The pictures are beautiful. Well done.
Excellent in production and content and sure to engage the user every day.
Excellent production~
Great stuff!
We keep the calendars after the year is passed. Beautiful and informative.
Loaded with info for the space/astronomy enthusiast.  And is a great calendar !
This is an awesome calender!

I have purchased The Year in Space calendar for three years now, and keep the calendars after the year is over.  This is obviously a labor of love, with so much research and time put into creating exciting layouts and calendar pages packed with information and spectacular images on heavy-duty glossy stock (it won't tear where it hangs on the nail).  Each month includes a large photo, several smaller images with accompanying text, bios of significant scientists and space explorers including women, and daily entries of important events and births, deaths, and so on.

The quality of production and research is worth far more than the price.  It would make a great gift or personal purchase for both the serious space aficionado or a kid with a passing interest in science.
summary: Stunning images, beautiful layout, great information

reviewText: Has beautiful pictures, as well as interesting fun facts about space that makes each month fresh.
summary: Meets all my requirements for a callendar

reviewText: Space is back! MAVEN around Mars. Orion new ride for our astronauts. World View Three. Dream chaser. Just to mention a few. To appreciate the history in great color, great photos, and great notes buy a copy of the 2015 Year in Space calendar. To stay upto date, join the Planetary Society (www. Planetary.org).

reviewText: If your looking for a calendar with one-of-a-kind photos of space and planetary objects AND info on how they were taken and what the next steps will be, then look no further, it's here. This is a good calendar if you enjoy getting little astronomy facts every day, like "Moon at apogee," or "Venus and Jupiter less than 0.4 degrees apart." Of course every day shows the phase of the Moon, and times are given for the quarter phases, e.g. "First Quarter Moon 7:03 AM ET." Because every day has a box with a fair amount of information, there won't be a lot of room for writing "Aunt Gladys coming for lunch, 11:30," but that's fine with me.
There are also plenty of pictures and information boxes off to the side of the calendar area.
summary: This is a good calendar if you enjoy getting little astronomy facts every ...

Important space related achievements are noted on relevant dates. I highly recommend this calendar to all.

reviewText: I've been buying the Year In Space Desk Calendar for over 10 years now and the wall calendar fotr the last two since it came out. They make great gifts to Space inclined friends due to the great pictures (one for each week on the desk calendar), historical space data for each day and they let you know of upcoming NASA missions and stellar events. The Nebula and galaxy pictures are really good. Love this stuff.

Great Desk Calendar!
And the new Wall Calendar is just as full of great pictures and information.
I have purchased these for many years now.

The pictures are "out of this world!"

This calendar is a must have for space enthusiasts or as a means to educate people about space. Kids can learn about science and history through pictures and reading about role models that made great discoveries. I buy one every year and people stop by my desk at work to look at the pictures and read the great information. Every day provides information about this day in history from a space science perspective. You will also get the normal calendar information for things like holidays, daylight savings time, etc.

While you are at it, please check out The Planetary Society! This group was started by Carl Sagan and is now run by Bill Nye. A great group for promoting science education and providing average people to participate in actual space missions.
summary: Kids can learn about science and history through pictures and reading about role models that made great discoveries. I buy one e

reviewText:
These calendars are awesome! The photo quality is excellent and the facts on both pages for each month add a nice touch to the theme being presented. There are numerous small photo collages placed around the calendar without making it look cluttered.
The days of the calendar also show some space fact(s) in history as well as the phases of the moon.
Well done!

reviewText: I have ordered this calendar for several years and have always been very pleased.  It is ideal for or as a gift for any "space geek".

reviewText: I love, "The Year in Space Calendars." They are pack with interesting facts about space exploration. I make it a point to read all the information each month. It's sad that the United States has fallen so far behind in space exploration. I was fortunate enough to work on the Apollo program and at that time we all believed that we would have a colony on the Moon and Mars by now. Instead we are a hopelessly divided country being run by selfish reactionary idiots. We have lost our technological edge and there is no national will to get it back. I never thought that I would be reading about NASA's past glory in history books.
summary: Good Product Packed With Interesting Information

reviewText: As an amateur astronomer and long-time spaceflight enthusiast I've bought numerous space calendars over the years, but I think this one is currently the best! I especially like the "mix" of information about current astronomical events, key milestones in spaceflight history, and recent scientific discoveries about the planets and stars--all in a very pleasing format. This company also produces an excellent desk calendar.
Arrived in a timely manor. A beautiful calendar.

Our family has purchased these calendars - both the wall calendar and the book version for years.  My father worked on the Apollo program in the 60's and 70's and so my parents originally gave them to our family for Christmas every year - now we do this ourselves for our kids/grandkids.  The pictures are truly fabulous and the comments about them are very interesting!
The photos and graphics are great.  I look forward to the start of each month to read about what's coming up and our history in space.  A really wonderful Calendar for any space geek.
summary: The photos and graphics are great. I look forward to the start of each ...

reviewText: Great pictures with excellent pertinent factoids.

This is my second year purchasing this calendar and it is quite possibly the best calendar there is if you like space related themes.  Here are some reasons:

1. It's got science!  Everything from discussion of different planets, different space missions and even stories about scientists and astronauts are included in this calendar ALONG with fantastic imagery!
2.  It's got history!  If its related to space, you will see it each day.  When did Apollo 7 take off?  When was Galileo born?  It's all in there on a day to day basis.
3.  You know what's happening up there!!  Is it a full moon?  Is there a meteor shower happening?  It's all there on a day to day basis too.  And if you have an immature family, you can even laugh when the moon is in opposition to Uranus.  :)
summary: ... purchasing this calendar and it is quite possibly the best calendar there is if you like space related themes

reviewText: What more needs to be said?

SPLENDID CALENDAR!  We have been ordering the "YEAR in SPACE" wall calendar for several years. I give one to my science-oriented grandson and keep one for myself - its on the wall near where I dress so I can peruse the 'tidbits' of info - a bit at a time - for the whole month.  It is an entertaining and informative and instructive.  My grandson keeps it in his room and he often talks to me about the news and analysis that appear on each month's page. Looking at it each morning reminds me of the much larger cosmos and puts the petty annoyances of my busy life into healthy perspective.
summary: SPLENDID CALENDAR! We have been ordering the "YEAR in ...

reviewText:
I bought the 2014 calendar and I was very impressed so I got the 2015 as well. The calendar is awesome, great pictures, lots of information and great print quality. In addition every day there is "What happened in history on Astronomy" so you can surprise your friends, for instance in my 2014 calendar for today November 20th 2014 I see:
1889: Edwin Hubble was born
1998: Zarya module launched, first element of International Space Station
2002: First Delta IV launched
2004: Swift spacecraft launched

In addition you are helping the planetary society, so there is no downside of getting it!
summary: Must have for any space enthusiast

reviewText: Love the Year in Space calendars and have been purchasing them for about 3 or 4 years as a Christmas gift for my son!  He loves them, too, and it has become a traditional gift.

reviewText: The information in the calendar looks great again this year. And as always, the photos are awesome! I always look forward to starting my day at work by taking a quick trip through the galaxy.
great calendar

I have the wall calendar and look forward to each month change-over.  There is a lot of interesting information on each of the monthly pages.  I would highly recommend this calendar to anyone with an interest in the Solar System, the Universe, and/or space travel.

This is a terrific wall calendar. Informative and beautiful, I buy 2 every year (3rd year, so far). One for myself and one for a friend, who is also into space, for a Christmas present. Introduction by Bill Nye, the Science Guy, the CEO of the Planetary Society. Anybody who is fascinated by space will love this calendar.
This is an ongoing must have Christmas present for my husband. Love it!
Beautiful photography as well as very interesting facts about space. I buy the desk and wall calendar every for my office.
Always a great Christmas gift and seems to get better every year.
Very best space calendar available. I keep the old ones up just for the pictures.
This is a great calendar for a space/science enthusiast! The combination of current and historic activities (March features the X-15!) makes the calendar very interesting.
This is a necessity for anyone interested in space science.  Colorful and informative.  A great gift for young space enthusiasts, or old ones, for that matter.

The Year In Space Wall calendars are full of interesting information that we DO NOT hear about in the news. It highlights scientists that are making history. The calendar is a good size and shows holidays as well. I give this calendar as Christmas gifts. People love receiving it. Great for kids too.
Great graphics and info on the latest developments.
Informative, fun, and great photos. Great reminders of significant events related to astronomy, space travel, and space exploration.
Great calendar, very informative.  Beautiful pictures of space phenomena as well as interesting space facts on every page.  Also, it is large enough to write whatever you need to in the dates.

Have purchased the calendars for three years, including desk version and love them. Good quality with lots of interesting space-related material. They make great gifts for space geeks, and especially children who have a budding interest in space.
This calendar gets better every year. Great pictures and info tidbits.

Love it! Great presentation and colors!
Highly recommended!
These calendars are great. These make excellent gifts. They are packed well and shipped quickly. You can't go wrong!
Get one... great pictures... you won't regret it.
Fantastic product. I get it for my partner every year and have never been disappointed.

The best space calendar there is! Printed on high quality matt paper which is a nice touch so you don't get lots of reflection from lights as some glossy versions suffer from, this is the one for all space enthusiasts young and old! Spread over two pages per month the top part has always interesting facts and lovely pictures and the bottom part has further facts on most days throughout the month - need to know when Edwin Hubble was born? It was November 20th 1889! This calendar is also a good conversation piece for visitors and colleagues and a great way to brighten up any wall.
summary: The best space calendar there is

reviewText: I bought this calender for the first time last year, mostly for my son. The detail of this calender really amazed me. So this year I bought a few extra to donate to my sons school. I'm hoping the calender will have a strong influence on the school kids and give them a glimpse of what is out there. Maybe inspire the next Christopher colombus.  I love the detail! These calenders are amazing! Thanks Steve, for creating such a  inspiring masterpiece! !
Anyone interested in space must have this calendar.  Not only are the pictures stunning, but the calendar is filled with facts and information.  Must buy!
Extremely informative with a wealth of knowledge available every month.  I have bought several to give to aspiring scientists as well as teachers.  It is such a great price for so much information.
Every page has a terrific space photo . The calendar pages have useful information for the space fan, and the calendar pages are large size to write important dates. It's worth getting.

These calendars are spectacular. I've ordered at least 10 for the past three years, as they make great holiday gifts for my friends and family members who are interested in astronomy and space. The photos are gorgeous and the calendars pages are filled with interesting facts and historical information. Even my 94-year-old father-in-law loves getting his. The day it arrives, he reads through the pages for the whole year, because it is so interesting. My sons both love seeing the new photos each month.
summary: We look forward to this spectacular calendar every year!

reviewText: I ordered both the wall and desk versions of the Year in Space calendar in 2014.  I was VERY impressed with both types, which I used in our astronomy-theme bed & breakfast. My order for 2015 was placed even before the reminder notices came out from the publisher this autumn---I didn't want to miss out! These calendars are chock-a-block full of useful information and photos are beautifully reproduced. I feel that they are absolutely the best value out there. The cost is very modest versus the incredible product. I am planning to gift one or two to friends who do not know what they're missing. Thanks for this great product!

This is the best wall calendar I've ever bought! Each page has a story to tell and its great for young readers with acquiring minds. I find the information interesting and useful. Check out the desk calendar too!

I have been buying this Space Calendar every year and that is a testament to its quality! I would recommend it to anyone who is inspired by wonderful pictures of space and information on space exploration.

reviewText: Very colorful and superb photos, oversized pages, packed with informative paragraphs about the month's celestial object, and I really enjoy the historical notes on the oversize date blocks, which still leave room for one's daily schedule notes. The tie-in with the  Planetary Society in Pasadena, CA. is a good idea. A great value, the best space calendar I've been able to get. Bill.

I been buying these calendars for years and they are top notch!  Large format with tons of information pertaining to space and mans efforts to explore and understand our place in the universe, illustrated with beautiful photography.  Highly recommended!!!
summary: illustrated with beautiful photography. Highly recommended

reviewText: You don't need to be an Astronomer or a Galactic Scientist to appreciate this wall calendar. The photos are amazing and the facts presented a true learning experience. At our house there's a rush to turn the page on the first of each month. Whether a child or an adult you will learn more than the sum of all newspapers that may have covered some of these important events.

The second year members of the  Barnard Astronomical Society have ordered these calendars.  We discovered them last year and most of the same members ordered again for 2015. It is an excellent product. Your desk model is also popular with our members.

Being a member of the Planetary Society (you can too...  just google Planetary Society) I like to support various astronomical endeavors.  I am involved with SETI@home (you can too... just google SETI@home) and The Year in Space helps keep me up-to-date with what is going on and various astronomical happenings that occur on a regular basis. Great Pictures and Information!
My husband's main request for Christmas every year.
Excellent, entertaining, educational, accurate - well done!
This calendar is a great way to stay connected to the universe.  The subject matter covered and presented is stunning.  I am a multiple repeat buyer.
This is one of the best calendars that you can buy for anyone the is interested in the cosmos & a great learning tool for the next generation of scientist.
Every year this calendar delivers.

reviewText: Absolutely the best space / astronomy calendar!  Very well done.

If you are an astronomy and/or space buff like me, you will absolutely dig this calendar.  The photos are top notch with lots of research done on the widely varying topics of the month.  I have been using this calendar for 3 years now and proudly display it in my office.  I always have people walking by admiring the beautiful content.  Don't hesitate to get this calendar!
summary: If you are an astronomy and/or space buff like me, you will absolutely dig this calendar

reviewText: High quality images printed beautifully in color on heavy stock, surrounded by facts on astronomy, space exploration history, and more.  What a class act!  I've been getting the desk calendar for more than a decade, and last year Steve brought out this wall calendar.  Had to have it!  Worth every penny, and hang it a prominent place so one may stand there for minutes and absorb all the information printed on the great photographic content.  Yes, as other reviewers said, every school room should have one so our kids will have their interest piqued about space stuff like we got from TV news when we were kids in the 60s-70s.
summary: Look! Up in the sky... Is that a star, a satellite, or ... Check the Year In Space Calendar and know for sure.

reviewText: Beautiful space photos.  Lots of information!
summary: A great gift for those who are interested in space.

reviewText: Great pics, interesting facts, and large enough to see the dates.
I was amazed by the "astronomical" number of photos on each page above and beside the calendar, and the historical trivia information within the calendar date boxes.  A-OK!
summary: I was amazed by the "astronomical" number of photos on each page ...

reviewText: This is something that I look forward to buying every year!  It is not only beautiful but full of interesting facts and bios on various scientists working in various space related programs.  I recommend this to anyone with an interest in space & science!
summary: It is not only beautiful but full of interesting facts and bios on various ...

reviewText: I enjoy this calendar because it has a plethora of information - and it reminds me daily of my father who was an avid star gazer.  This is an excellent company and publisher.
I've bought these calendars for the past several years, and the quality is exceptional.  Ordering is simple and delivery is fast.  Great people to work with.
This calendar is not only beautiful and of high quality, it also helps educate.  Every classroom should have one and the teacher should include the month's topic on the first day of that month.
Stunning photos, lots of cool facts.  I've been buying this calendar for many years and I love it.
summary: lots of cool facts. I've been buying this calendar for many ...

reviewText: This is a fantastic resource!  Teaching my middle grade students is a lot easier thanks to the plethora of information that this calendar shares.

Last year the Starry Merssenger Press started offering a beautiful wall calendar along with their standard desk calendar.  These people put together an outstanding collection of space and astronomy photos, facts, significant dates in history and more.  The desk calendar is perfect for anyone that is interested in astronomical photography and information about hisotrical space events.  The wall calendar is perfect for kids and adults that love beautiful space images and interesting facts about space and astromony.  I have been getting the desk calendars for over 10 years now and have always been 100% satisfied with the beautiful product produced by Steve qand the gang.
one of the best calendars available.

I cannot review the calendar till after the 1st of January 2015; well maybe at Christmas. They are wrapped. The desk calendars and the wall calendars await Christmas and the new year.
GBP.
A class product for anyone who loves science fiction or real space science!
Every year I look forward to this calendar. Beautiful pictures, tons of interesting facts, and lots of space to add my appointments. If you are a space nerd you will not be disappointed!
WOW! Best calendar ever. Period.
A really great space calendar. If you're into science, astronomy or space, you'll like this.
My first was a lemon. I had no problems getting a replacement and they were quick in getting another mailed out for replacement. Second one received work like a charm. :)
summary: Second one received work like a charm

reviewText: Did hot work as described

The title insinuates that it is a genuine Samsung product but it is not and only worked intermittently and after 3 months ....does not work at all.  Pretty clear why it's so cheap.  Don't fall for it.  I would give it zero stars if I could.
summary: Pretty clear why it's so cheap

reviewText: Performed exactly as advertised.

Plays movies well.  Sound and picture are great. (1080i/p)  Only thing I don't like is it does not charge my tablet (Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2).  But I just make sure my tablet is fully charged before I start a movie.  No biggie.  It did take a while to get here because it shipped from China.
Works for the 12inch Note to display on the monitor but it won't charge the tablet while being used.
This does NOT work for the 12.2 tablet I had bought one from samsung and the end is totally different.
It worked very well and was not as complicated as the previous adapter that I used.
Did not work at all on my note 2. Wouldnt recommend anyone buy this product.
Both Quality and performance are excellent
Works as advertised.

Disappointed in product. Yes it's a pest having to have the charger plugged in but could adapt IF it could at least charge the tablet while watching movies.  I thought I  was purchasing a nice quality product for my Samsung pro tab but its trash and that's exactly where it is going.

At first I thought this did not work with my Tab Pro but it turns out you have to plug a power cord into the side micro USB port for it to work. It's advertised as a way to keep the tablet charged while in use but unless the adapter itself needs to charge first, which I'll soon find out, you'll need to plug it in during use.
summary: Must have plugged in to charging cord too

reviewText: Did not fit my tablet
good stuff works on newer TV's. didn't work on an older visio.

Unfortunately the case did not fit my son's iphone 5 properly (wiggled and moved too much despite attempts to tighten it)
We know the difference because he had the same case for his iphone 4 and that one fit well.
The cost to return it does not make sense, we will donate it most likely.
This blocks all cell signal, can't use phone for calls or wifi.  Prob better for an iPod nice item though and shipping was quick.  Wouldn't hesitate buying from seller on different items
Bought and can't use because I can't make a phone call with it on. It only got two stars because it looks great.

Looks great, feels like it protects the phone. Wish it didn't block all of my signal. Especially maps my phone had no idea where I was when it was on.

Conveniently labels your buttons so you don't forget what they do
summary: Awesome but I'd rather have signal.

reviewText: Its a good case and nice design on the back but the iphone antenna is in the corners so it mess up the signal but other than that the case is good
I upgrade in Feb so I bought this for myself to protect my iPhone 5... It's great haven't seen it on the phone yet but it's so futuristic .

I love the way this case looks and it is very protective.
Unfortunately it knocks a couple of bars off the signal.
summary: Looks way cool but blocks the signal
